description: We will be opening the Hall and Library of the  Middle Temple on Sunday 15 September between 12 and 4pm for tours.

events.name: Drop in: Open Day
events.notes: Please let us know if you plan to visit. Doing so allows the venue to plan ahead and you will be notified by email about any changes to the programme that might affect your visit.

factsheet.heading: Middle Temple Hall
paragraphs: Middle Temple Hall and Library will be open on Sunday 15 September between 12 and 4pm for visitors to view the historic building.  The library will be open and visitors will have the opportunity to view the rare pair of Molyneux Globes.
Middle Temple hall dates back to 1574, was visited by Queen Elizabeth I and hosted the first performance of Shakespeare's Twelfth Night.

factsheet.heading: Middle Temple
paragraphs: The Honourable Society of the Middle Temple is one of four Inns of Court exclusively entitled to Call their members to the Bar of England and Wales, and is proud to provide support, education and accommodation to barristers at every stage of their careers.

factsheet.heading: Library
paragraphs: Middle Temple Library holds approximately 30,000 legal titles in 250,000 volumes, including legislation, case law, textbooks, student manuals, loose-leaf publications, journals and law reports.

The Library collects legal texts in certain specialist subject areas such as banking, commercial law and arbitration, competition, employment, insurance, professional negligence and shipping, amongst others.
Additionally, the Library is home to the remaining pair of Molyneux Globes which will be on display for visitors to see.

factsheet.heading: The Garden Room
paragraphs: The Garden Room (located on Middle Temple Lane) will be open from 11:00 till 16:00 and will serve a variety of food and beverages.
